nodes.documentation: Returns the name of the token
nodes.name: name

nodes.documentation: Returns the symbol of the token.
nodes.name: symbol

nodes.documentation:
Returns the number of decimals the token uses - e.g. 8, means to divide the token amount by 100000000 to get its user representation.
As per Ether & Wei relationship usually token are of value 18.
nodes.name: decimals

nodes.documentation: Returns the total token supply.
nodes.name: totalSupply

nodes.documentation: Returns the account balance of holder account with address.
nodes.name: balanceOf

nodes.documentation:
Transfers _value amount of tokens to address _to, and MUST fire the Transfer event.
The function SHOULD throw if the message caller’s account balance does not have enough tokens to spend.
Transfers of 0 values MUST be treated as normal transfers and fire the Transfer event.
nodes.name: transfer

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Badium Token: transfer amount exceeds allowance"

arguments.value: Badium Token: transfer amount exceeds allowance

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Badium Token: transfer amount exceeds allowance"

nodes.documentation:
The transferFrom method is used for a withdraw workflow, allowing contracts to transfer tokens on your behalf. 
This can be used for example to allow a contract to transfer tokens on your behalf and/or to charge fees in sub-currencies. 
The function SHOULD throw unless the _from account has deliberately authorized the sender of the message via some mechanism.
Emits an Approval event indicating the updated allowance.
nodes.name: transferFrom

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Badium Token: approve to the invalid or zero address"

arguments.value: Badium Token: approve to the invalid or zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Badium Token: approve to the invalid or zero address"

nodes.documentation:
Allows _spender to withdraw from holder account multiple times, up to the _value amount. 
If this function is called again it overwrites the current allowance with _value
nodes.name: approve

nodes.documentation:
Returns the amount which _spender is still allowed to withdraw from _owner or holder.
The maximum amount that the spender is approved to transfer from the holder's tokens.
nodes.name: allowance

nodes.documentation: Adds the address to the list of allowed receivers.
nodes.name: addReceiver

nodes.documentation: Removes or deactivate the given address from the list of approved receivers.
nodes.name: removeReceiver

nodes.name: selectCirculatorySystem

nodes.documentation:
Buy given amount of Badium token from Owner with given exchange rate of 0.01 ether.
Bought tokens are credited to the message sender.
Owner recieves the transferred ether balance from contract.
Emits a Transfer event with Owner as sender & transaction initiator as receiver.
nodes.name: buy

Returns the number of decimals the token uses - e.g. 8, means to divide the token amount by 100000000 to get its user representation.
As per Ether & Wei relationship usually token are of value 18.

Transfers _value amount of tokens to address _to, and MUST fire the Transfer event.
The function SHOULD throw if the message caller’s account balance does not have enough tokens to spend.
Transfers of 0 values MUST be treated as normal transfers and fire the Transfer event.
attributes.name: transfer

attributes.documentation:
The transferFrom method is used for a withdraw workflow, allowing contracts to transfer tokens on your behalf. 
This can be used for example to allow a contract to transfer tokens on your behalf and/or to charge fees in sub-currencies. 
The function SHOULD throw unless the _from account has deliberately authorized the sender of the message via some mechanism.
Emits an Approval event indicating the updated allowance.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

receiveFundToOwner(uint256).details: recieve ether funds to payable owner address

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addReceiver(address).notice: Adds the address to the list of allowed receivers.

allowance(address,address).notice: Returns the amount which _spender is still allowed to withdraw from _owner or holder. The maximum amount that the spender is approved to transfer from the holder's tokens.

approve(address,uint256).notice: Allows _spender to withdraw from holder account multiple times, up to the _value amount.  If this function is called again it overwrites the current allowance with _value

balanceOf(address).notice: Returns the account balance of holder account with address.

burn(address,uint256).notice: Burns specified amount of token from given holder's account Emits a Transfer event with 'to' set to the zero address.

burnAll().notice: Burn all tokens in current circulatory system index

buy(uint256).notice: Buy given amount of Badium token from Owner with given exchange rate of 0.01 ether. Bought tokens are credited to the message sender. Owner recieves the transferred ether balance from contract. Emits a Transfer event with Owner as sender & transaction initiator as receiver.

decimals().notice: Returns the number of decimals the token uses - e.g. 8, means to divide the token amount by 100000000 to get its user representation. As per Ether & Wei relationship usually token are of value 18.

getCurrentCirculatorySystem().notice: Returns current Badium Token circulatory system index

mint(uint256).notice: Increase total supply of Badium token. Specified amount is added to Owner's account Emits a Transfer event with 'from' set to the zero address.

name().notice: Returns the name of the token

removeReceiver(address).notice: Removes or deactivate the given address from the list of approved receivers.

selectCirculatorySystem(uint256).notice: Select any existing Badium Token circulatory system to switch between different circulatory systems

symbol().notice: Returns the symbol of the token.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Transfers _value amount of tokens to address _to, and MUST fire the Transfer event. The function SHOULD throw if the message caller’s account balance does not have enough tokens to spend. Transfers of 0 values MUST be treated as normal transfers and fire the Transfer event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: The transferFrom method is used for a withdraw workflow, allowing contracts to transfer tokens on your behalf.  This can be used for example to allow a contract to transfer tokens on your behalf and/or to charge fees in sub-currencies.  The function SHOULD throw unless the _from account has deliberately authorized the sender of the message via some mechanism. Emits an Approval event indicating the updated allowance.
